results.name: Half of the (n+1)-st component of the continued fraction expansion of sum(k>=1,1/2^(2^k)).
comment: To construct the sequence use the rule : a(1)=2 then a(a(1)+a(2)+...+a(n)+1)=2 and fill in any undefined places with the sequence 1,3,1,3,1,3,1,3,1,3,1,3,.....
This sequence appears to be the sequence of run lengths of the regular paperfolding sequence A014577, i.e. the latter starts as follows: 2 zeros, 1 one, 2 zeros, 2 ones, etc. (End)
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
example: Example to illustrate the comment : a(a(1)+1)=a(3)=2 and a(2) is undefined. The rule forces a(2)=1. Next, a(a(1)+a(2)+1)=a(4)=2, a(a(1)+a(2)+a(3)+1)=a(6)=2 and a(5) is undefined. The rule forces now a(5)=3.
program: (Scheme) (define (A088431 n) (* 1/2 (A007400 (+ 1 n)))) ;; Code for A007400 given under that entry. - _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 12 2017
